com.diogonunes.jcdp.color.api

Interface IColoredPrinter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPrinter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractColoredPrinter, ColoredPrinter, UnixColoredPrinter, WindowsColoredPrinter

    public interface IColoredPrinter
extends IPrinter
    Every class that implements this interface is called a Colored Printer. A Colored Printer is an extension of a Printer hence, plus everything a Printer can do, this Colored Printer must offer a set of methods to print in a terminal with format. This format is specified by three components (check Ansi):Attribute, Foreground Color, Background Color. Every Colored Printer must store internally a current format. Every print must reflect this format. It must also offer ways to print a message with a format that momentously overrides the current format.
    Version:
    1.2 beta
    Author:
    Diogo Nunes

      • debugPrint

        void debugPrint(Object msg,
                int level,
                Ansi.Attribute attr,
                Ansi.FColor fg,
                Ansi.BColor bg)
        Prints a debug message to terminal, overriding current format, if the printer has enough level of debug to print that message.
        Parameters:
        msg - Debug message to print
        level - Level of debug needed to print msg
        attr - specifies the overriding attribute
        fg - specifies the foreground color
        bg - specifies the background color
